clinical_study.brief_title: Incidence of Complications of Brain Death
clinical_study.official_title: Incidence of Complications in Brain Death Organ Donors. Retrospective Observational Study.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to describe the incidence of complications in brain death adult organ donors.

detailed_description.textblock: Pathophysiological changes following brain death may complicate the care of brain death donors. These complications negatively affects function of donated organs. Understanding these complications and its incidence is crucial for their appropriate management. The aim of this retrospective observational study is to evaluate the incidence of complications in adult brain death organ donors. Date will be collected from medical records of eligible patients admitted to intensive care unit for suspected brain death in whom brain death was confirmed and who become organ donors.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48hours prior confirmation of brain death to ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Hypotension is defined as increase of vasoactive drug dose by 20% or systolic blood pressure lower than 90 mmHg or need for fluid resuscitation after initial normovolemia was achieved

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48hours prior confirmation of brain death to ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Maximal lactate level will be evaluated during ICU stay

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48hours prior confirmation of brain death to ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Catecholamine storm is defined as onset of tachycardia and/or hypertension

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48hours prior confirmation of brain death to ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Myocardial dysfunction is defined as left ventricle ejection fraction under 50% on trans-thoracic echocardiography or S-T segment depression or elevation or T wave negativity or positive troponin serum level

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48hours prior confirmation of brain death to ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: ARDS is defined and stratified according to Berlin definition

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48hours prior confirmation of brain death to ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Oxygenation index will be calculated as PaO2 divided by FiO2

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48hours prior confirmation of brain death to ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Diabetes insipidus is defines as urine output more than 4ml/kg per hour or urine specific gravity under 1010

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48hours prior confirmation of brain death to ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Renal dysfunction is defined as presence of at least one of these criteria: absolute increase in serum creatinine ≥0.3 mg/dL (≥26.4 μmol/L) or increase in serum creatinine ≥1.5x above baseline or oliguria (urine output <0.5 mL/kg per hour) for >6 hours

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48hours prior confirmation of brain death to ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Coagulopathy is defined as international normalised ratio above 1,5 or platelet count below 100 000 per microliter

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48hours prior confirmation of brain death to ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Body temperature below 36°C or need for external warming

study_pop.textblock: Adult critically ill patinets with confirmed brain death admitted to university hospital who become brain death organ donor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age ≥18 years
- confirmed brain death
- organ donor
Exclusion Criteria:
- age under 18 years
